Job Title: Data Engineers and Technical Business Analysts
Ad Text:
Job Title: Technical Business Analyst and Data Engineer Required

Location: Australia (Hybrid / Remote options depending on organisation)
Employment Type: Full‑time

About the Role - Data Engineer

We’re looking for a skilled Data Engineer to join our high‑performing Agile delivery team. You’ll play a key role in designing, building, and optimising modern data pipelines and platforms using Azure, Databricks, and Python. If you enjoy solving complex data problems and working closely with cross‑functional teams in a Scrum environment, this role will suit you perfectly.

Key Responsibilities

Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL/ELT processes

Develop high‑quality code in Python and SQL

Build and optimise data solutions using Azure Databricks and broader Azure cloud services

Implement DevOps practices including CI/CD, version control, and automated testing

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and business stakeholders

Contribute to Agile ceremonies and work effectively within a Scrum team

Ensure data quality, reliability, and performance across all data products

Skills & Experience

Proven experience as a Data Engineer in cloud‑based environments

Strong proficiency in Databricks, SQL, and Python

Hands‑on experience with Azure (Data Lake, Data Factory, Synapse, Functions, etc.)

Solid understanding of DevOps practices and tools

Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams

Strong problem‑solving skills and attention to detail

Excellent communication and collaboration abilities

Job Title: Technical Business Analyst

Location: Australia (Hybrid / Remote options depending on organisation)
Employment Type: Full‑time

About the Role

We’re seeking an experienced Technical Business Analyst with deep knowledge of data platforms, data pipelines, and regulatory reporting. You’ll act as the bridge between business stakeholders and technical delivery teams, ensuring requirements are clearly defined, understood, and implemented using modern Azure‑based data technologies.

Key Responsibilities

Lead stakeholder engagement, workshops, and requirement‑gathering sessions

Translate business needs into clear, actionable technical requirements

Work closely with Data Engineers and Architects to design data solutions

Analyse and document data flows, data models, and end‑to‑end pipeline behaviour

Support regulatory and compliance reporting initiatives

Contribute to Agile ceremonies and collaborate within Scrum teams

Ensure alignment between business outcomes and technical delivery

Skills & Experience

Proven experience as a Technical BA in data‑focused environments

Strong understanding of data pipelines, data warehousing, and data modelling

Experience working with Azure, Databricks, SQL, and modern data engineering practices

Demonstrated ability to manage diverse stakeholders and competing priorities

Excellent documentation skills (user stories, acceptance criteria, process flows)

Experience in regulatory reporting or compliance‑driven data projects

Strong analytical mindset and ability to translate complex concepts clearly

Why Join Us?

Work on impactful, enterprise‑level data initiatives

Collaborate with talented data professionals

Flexible work environment

Career development and training opportunities

Job Title: Commercial Finance Manager - Global Marketing Agency
Ad Text:
Our client
High growth global marketing agency. They've got operations nationwide and have shown great expansion across their multiple states. A closely knit and stable team with excellent leadership. 

This role reports and works closely with an experienced CFO.

This role would suit a high achieving Senior Analyst ready to step into their first management role.

The role

Business partnering - provide value add analysis and support in addressing profitability opportunities and challenges.
Responsible for annual budget and rolling quarterly forecast
Provide insights and develop tools to support business management to make informed assessments for strategic cost and pricing decisions.
Pricing and margin reviews of various sales channels and promotional product campaigns         
Capital investment reviews for proposed new products and existing product upgrade investments to be submitted for Board approval   
Preparation of papers for board submissions

About you

Experience in a fast paced environment is essential - retail, FMCG, ecommerce, marketing, media, etc.
Strong experience with analysis and financial planing (budget/forecast). 
Proven experience business partnering with non-finance stakeholders - providing revenue generating insights and recommendations 
At least 3+ years of experience in commercial finance role/s  
 

For more information contact Schenuk Wijesekera on 02 9775 5916 or apply using the "Apply" button.

Job Title: Principal Digital Data & Reporting | Digital Team (Brisbane, Adelaide or Perth)
Ad Text:
The size, stability and magnitude of our business not only provides significant opportunity for professional development, but also attractive salary packages with performance-based bonuses and a best-in-class employee share program. We know there are many aspects of our employees' lives that are important, and work is only one of these, so we offer benefits to enable your work to fit with your life. These benefits include flexible working options, a generous paid parental leave policy, other extended leave entitlements and parent rooms.  

At BHP, we know that we are strengthened by diversity. We are an Equal Opportunity employer that is committed to making BHP a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone can thrive and be at their best every day. We are focused on creating a workforce that’s more diverse and represents the communities where we work and live. providing a work environment in which everyone is included, treated fairly and with respect. We are an Equal Opportunity employer and recognise that true diversity includes gender, age, race, disability status, sexual orientation, religion, neurodiversity, education levels, and many more aspects of your identity.

BHP is committed to providing a recruitment process that is fair, equitable and accessible for all. If you have a disability, we know that it may be helpful for us to adjust our process to make it equitable for your individual situation. If you would like to reach out to someone about your situation and our recruitment process, please email us at inclusion@bhp.com.
